data.title: One of the best in the Bay Area
data.text: Hu Fu has been my to-go restaurant whenever we have guests.  It has a good variety of dishes on the menu which will suit for all the people.  The food is quite authentic unlike other American Chinese restaurants.  There are many dishes I like and here I can introduce a few that people usually don't know how to order.  The Lion's Head (fist-size meat ball) is super tender and it comes in individual bowl as a serving.  The smoked duck usually is my favorite and not greasy at all.   The beef medallions with mushrooms and black pepper is very very good.   In additional to food, the table layout in the restaurant is spacious so you are not back to back into other customers.   Each table has a white table cloth.  This is a Chinese restaurant where you can actually have a reasonable not so noisy environment to have some conversations.   The lunch menu is quite inexpensive with very good value.   I did notgive 5 stars because I have very high standard for Chinese restaurants and 5 stars is reserved for the top level restaurants in New York, Hong Kong, Taipei, etc.  Hong Fu is probably one of the top (3-4) restaurants in the Bay Area with food, service, environment, value combined.

data.title: Favorite Chinese Restaurant
data.text: Hong Fu has been my family's favorite Chinese Restaurant since we moved here over 25 years ago.  Our favorite is 'yo ling ji', a tasty fried chicken.  There's a private banquet room for celebrations.  Great location, good family ambience and consistent quality food makes this a great place for families.

data.title: Average food with average service
data.text: Facing a lot of competition. This restaurant serves average food. I did not taste any dish outstanding. The service is average too.

data.title: A Slow Dinner with Relatives - All Senior Citizen
data.text:
1.  We like this restaurant because it offers a variety of different Chinese Cuisine
2.  Food was great
3.  Service is good for Friday night dinner, the busiest evening of the week.  Very attentive toward us.
4.  Bathrooms could be better
5.  Tea served could be higher grade - it made us feel we are being served cheaply.
6.  Like the attentions given by the owner
7.  Highly recommend and we will be back
8.  Total bill was slightly higher than we expected.

data.title: Great food!
data.text: The food has kept us coming back for more than 15 years. The lunch specials are excellent. They have both the expected fare and more traditional items. If you are adventurous, ask for the red menu. You will find very traditional Chinese dishes on it.

data.title: expensive
data.text: This is a $$ for chinese food.  They have good service, and good food, but you pay for it.  The location is great, and the parking is good.  Overall, I am satisfied.  If I can afford it, I will be back.

data.title: On the best Chinese places in Cupertino
data.text: Great menu and service.  This place is great for lunch or dinner.  The place is very large and clean, selection was very large and parking was easy.  I've had several items, never been disappointed.

data.title: Rehearsal Dinner for Son's Wedding
data.text:
My son and his wife have been here quite often on dates so this was their choice for their rehearsal dinner.  I can't say enough about the staff here at Hong Fu.  They were so accommodating and we had amazing service from reservation to the end.  We had 31 people and a private room.  We preordered our menu to help the chefs order and prepare our selections and the whole night went as smooth as silk.  Our server Luis was professional and attentive and the food was off the charts delicious.  Several guests who had never been to the restaurant raved about the food and even said it was the best Chinese food they had ever had!! We have had other large family gatherings here as well (bdays, graduation celebrations) and have never been disappointed!!! 
5 Stars all around!  Thank you to you all at Hong Fu for making this special day that much more special 😊

Shawna from San Jose, CA

data.title: Good place for lunch
data.text:
3 of us were looking for a good place for lunch at the last minute.  My friend was looking for a good Chinese chicken salad.  There were set lunch menus but we didn't want that much food.  We ordered won ton soup, chicken salad, and  potstickers which was plenty for us.  All were good.  We were told when we ordered that the food would arrive in 15 minutes and it did.
Empty tea pot replaced right away 
Restaurant is in a busy shopping center, parking can be a problem,.

data.title: Average food - non existant service
data.text: Deceptively large restaurant packed with mostly Chinese customers all having a great time, large party going on in an adjacent room. Food normal Cantonese variety. Order brusquely taken used to this as have been to Hong Kong, Green Tea served in the traditional way. Good start but all seemed to go wrong. Food ok nothing special , large portions. Sadly pretty well ignored, not asked how meal was, offerred any drinks, starters were only cleared after several requests. Finally when the meal arrived not all at once and several requests for rice bowls and chopsticks,  finished again waiting for the table to be cleared bill just dumped on the table without a word. Never had that happen in my life. Would agree the restaurant is dirty, just look into the kitchen with cardboard boxes on the floor, toilet door broken and filth where the carpet meets the wall. On the adjacent table with Chinese customers seemed to get a completely level of service and I think a different menu. Every been in a restaurant where you wonder if you are invisible? The only good thing to say is it is cheap $50 for 2, no stomach problems this morning but probably more out of luck.

data.title: Good food
data.text:
Very plain strip mall restaurant. Plastic seat covers and simple old decor. 

BUT, the food was really good and price very reasonable. Service was rude.

data.title: Not my cup of tea; more like 2.5 circles
data.text: was here for a dinner with a large gathering so we had the separate room.  service was expected from a Chinese restaurant, not great, not bad.  food, overall, did not excite me.  i was immediately shocked when the won ton came with a dark salty broth (perhaps too much soy sauce?) instead of the lighter chicken or natural broth.  the won ton themselves were of poor quality.  the mu she chicken was decent and we were given additional pancakes/crepes for this dish.  Hong Fu's version of honey walnut prawns was a miss mainly because of the prawns.  to me they still should have a crunch from the light batter.  high marks for the braised eggplant with garlic.  we had several more dishes that were average overall.  located in a strip mall at the southwest corner of Stevens Creek and De Anza Blvds there is plenty of parking.  Access is easy from the freeway.  with the plethora of chinese restaurants in the greater bay area you won't miss out if you pass on Hong Fu.

data.title: Stay away.
data.text: This is a rather dirty restaurant. The Santa Clara County rating site gave them a yellow for below 70 out of 100 earlier this year. I accidentally walked into the kitchen looking for the bathroom and it was not very nice.

data.title: Dirty
data.text: A popular place.  Most diners were Chinese.  I've only had one meal here and it seems to be standard Hunan food.  But the lack of cleanliness is very evident. The menus are old, falling apart and sticky.  The bathroom is deplorable.  I'd near for back.

data.title: Very quick service
data.text:
I arrive there at 8:40pm. The restaurant closed at 9:00pm. However, the restaurant can still eager to take the order and provide the food at a very very quick speed. 

The food is good among those American Chinese restaurant.

data.title: Food is so-so
data.text: There are some good dishes, but many of them are just so-so.  It has pretty good business because of it's capacity and convenient parking (in a shopping center), so many big party size and luncheon event are held there.

data.title: Large restaurant with large menu
data.text:
This is a very large Chinese restaurant with a diverse but largely Chinese clientele. The decor is a very large room with white tablecloths and classical music playing, very nice. It is quiet except for the conversations; this is a bustling place with lots of people. The entry has a small koi pond. 

The menu has a wide selection plus now there is a new supplemental menu with more current Chinese food items including several spicy dishes. Tea is service. Beer and wine are available.

Service was good. Someone came to check on us late in the meal and ensured we had everything we wanted. That was a nice touch.

data.title: An old Cupertino favorite
data.text: We had a reservation for a large party and they accommodated us in a private room without issue. There was plenty of space for everyone. The service was good. Food was plentiful and delicious. We will return again.

data.title: We have never had a bad experiencel at Hong Fu
data.text: Completely love this restaurant!  We have been coming here for years with groups from 1 to 25 and always get excellent food and wonderful service.  Take out is also terrific.

data.title: Used to be great, now it is not
data.text:
This was my go-to restaurant for Chinese for years.  Only I noticed the place kept raising its prices, and it the place started to appear really dirty.  After having to use the restroom before picking up some take out food, I made my decision:  this place has gone downhill, raising its prices while ignoring upkeep and cleaning.  

Don't believe me?  Take one look at the carpet and visit the restaurant.  I can tolerate some dirt in restaurants, with all the food and grease they are impossible to keep spotless, but this place is grimy and gross.  And since it is quite expensive, I no longer go here, even for the lunch special that despite the grime in the place was really really tasty.  

If grime and grunge doesn't phase you, and you don't mind paying a premium, give it a try.  Otherwise, hopefully the management will read this and reinvest some of their profits in new carpeting and bathroom remodeling.
